Abstrak:
Asymmetric functionalization of alkyl radicals represents a robust yet
underdeveloped method for efficient construction and decoration of carbon skeletons in
chiral organic molecules. In this field, we have been inspired by the excellent redox, alkyl
radical trapping, and Lewis acidic properties of copper to develop several catalytic modes for
asymmetric reactions involving alkyl radicals. At the beginning, we discovered tandem
radical hydrotrifluoromethylation of unactivated alkenes and enantioselective alkoxylation of
remote ....
